Text.text: SAP Lumira helps you plot information by using a variety of different charts, including bar charts, line charts, and so on. However, you might want to create your own charts .The SAP Lumira helps you to develop your own charts and integrates it with SAP Lumira.The Usage Tracking tool displays the collected data with the help of SAP Lumira dashboard.
Usage Tracking tool organizes the collected data as measures and dimensions. They are listed below:
Measures and Dimensions
System measures
These are the default measures that system provides to organize your search result. For example, sequence no, tag name class, eventsubclass etc
System dimensions
These are the default dimensions that system provides to organize your search result. For example, applicationid, browsername, browserversion, city etc.
Custom measures and dimensions
These are the measures and dimensions that you create in order to organize your search results. For example, parent action, detail1, etc.
You use this procedure to visualize the collected data in Lumira dashboard.
Choose Analysis tab > Click Here for Lumira Server.
Note: SAP Lumira Server authorizes you using SSO credentials.
Choose the data set for which you want to visualize the charts.
Data set is set of columns, hierarchies and filters used to create a chart.
Select a chart from the list of charts.
You can change a chart type any time if you prefer another chart for visualization.
Create storyboard using the following custom configuration details:
Click a measure and drag it onto the chart body.
Click a dimension and drag it onto the chart body.
Add measures and dimensions as required.
If you want to create multiple charts in a storyboard, then choose the<+>icon.
Step Result: The storyboard generates a unique ID for different charts.
Copy the unique Id from the URL.
In the Usage Tracking page, paste the unique ID in the text field.
Choose Generate View, to visualize the collected data.
